Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Dermaseptin-SP2 (DRS-SP2, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: The gliding tree frog,Agalychnis spurrelli, Central America

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (89.3%) toDermaseptin-LI1.Activity: Active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 2.68 uM), S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 2.68 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 10.7 uM) and C. albicans (MIC 10.7 uM).Parasites: P. falciparum NF54 (IC50 12.06 uM) or TM90C2B (IC50 15.34 uM), L. Mexicana (IC50 0.61 uM) (Proaño-Bolaños et al., 2024.Updated 7/2024
Literature Information.Author: Proaño-Bolaños C, Blasco-Zúñiga A, Almeida JR, Wang L,  Llumiquinga MA, Rivera M, Zhou M, Chen T, Shaw C. 2019
Literature Information.Title: Unravelling the Skin Secretion Peptides of the Gliding Leaf Frog, Agalychnis spurrelli (Hylidae)
